content:
{{knowledge objective
|Identifiant=OIC-027-22-B
|Item_parent=Prevention of foetal risks: infection, drugs, toxic substances, irradiation
|Item_parent_short=Prevention of foetal risks: infection, drugs, toxic substances, irradiation
|Rank=B
|Title=Knowing the mechanisms of maternal-fetal transmission of streptococcus B
|Description=None
|Topic=Physiopathology
|Contributors=Alexandre Vivanti, Philippe Deruelle
|Order=22}}
The prevalence of vaginal carriage in France is between 10 and 20%.

Maternal-foetal infection with streptococcus B occurs via the vaginal, ascending route, with contamination during passage through the maternal genital tract during childbirth or prolonged rupture of foetal membranes.

question.title: How does maternal-foetal infection with streptococcus B typically occur?
question.description: The mode of transmission of maternal-foetal infection with streptococcus B

option_a.title: Maternal-foetal infection through the bloodstream
option_a.description: Transmission via the bloodstream from mother to foetus

option_b.title: Vaginal carriage during childbirth
option_b.description: Transmission via vaginal carriage during childbirth

option_c.title: Maternal-foetal infection through the placenta
option_c.description: Transmission via the placenta from mother to foetus

option_d.title: Maternal-foetal infection through the umbilical cord
option_d.description: Transmission via the umbilical cord from mother to foetus
